meanings.definition: Treat or coat (a metal) in order to reduce its chemical reactivity
meanings.sent1: The mechanic passivated the metal parts to make them less likely to rust.
meanings.sent2: The manufacturer passivated the steel beams to prevent corrosion.
meanings.sent3: The scientist passivated the metal, turning it into a superhero shield against rust villains.
meanings.sent4: The passivated metal stood strong against the corrosive forces, like a fortress protecting its inhabitants.
meanings.sent5: After being passivated, the metal seemed to have a magical shield that repelled any harmful substances.

meanings.definition: Render (a material) chemically inactive by the formation of a protective oxide layer
meanings.sent1: The chemist passivated the surface of the material to make it resistant to reactions.
meanings.sent2: The engineer passivated the metal to ensure it would not react with the surrounding environment.
meanings.sent3: The passivated material became the envy of all other materials, as it could relax without worrying about chemical drama.
meanings.sent4: The passivated material was like a fortress, impervious to the chemical attacks of its surroundings.
meanings.sent5: The passivated material gleamed under the sunlight, its protective layer shining like a beacon of safety.
